title.rendered: Free Guide to Apply for USMLE – US Medical Licensing Examination 2024

content.rendered:
Get started on your medical licensing journey with the USMLE application. Learn about eligibility, requirements, and fees to take the exams.

Are you a medical doctor, and would you propose to work in the United States or its environs? Here is an opportunity for you to write the US Medical Licensing Examination. Working as a medical Doctor in the United States is like being recognized as an expert entrusted with the lives and well-being of the citizenry. Before you can work as a Doctor in the USA, you must complete and pass the United States Medical Licensing Examination – USMLE.

What is USMLE | Medical Licensing Examination

 

The USMLE is advocated to assesses a physician’s ability to apply knowledge, concepts, and principles, and to demonstrate fundamental patient-centered skills, that are important in health and disease and that constitute the basis of safe and effective patient care.This is the best place to be licensed as a Medical practitioner.

The United States Medical Licensing Examination (USMLE) is a three-step examination that is required for all individuals who wish to practice medicine in the United States. The USMLE is sponsored by the Federation of State Medical Boards (FSMB) and the National Board of Medical Examiners (NBME).

The USMLE is designed to assess a physician’s ability to apply medical knowledge, skills, and understanding of clinical science necessary for the provision of patient care under supervision. The exam is taken by medical students and graduates who wish to practice medicine in the United States.

The three steps of the USMLE are:

USMLE Step 1:

Tests basic science knowledge that is essential for effective medical practice.

USMLE Step 2:

Divided into two parts, Clinical Knowledge (CK) and Clinical Skills (CS), which assess a physician’s ability to apply medical knowledge, skills, and understanding of clinical science necessary for the provision of patient care under supervision.

USMLE Step 3:

Assesses a physician’s ability to apply medical knowledge and understanding of biomedical and clinical science necessary for unsupervised medical practice.

The USMLE is a computer-based exam, and the results are reported on a pass/fail basis. Passing the USMLE is a requirement for medical licensure in the United States.

How Does USMLE Works?

The examination is designed in three-fold – 1, 2, and 3
Step 1
The Step 1 USMLE will assess a candidate whether they understand and can apply important concepts of the sciences basic to the practice of medicine, with special emphasis on principles and mechanisms underlying health, disease, and modes of therapy.
Step 2
Step 2 CK of USMLE will assess an examinee’s ability to apply medical knowledge, skills, and understanding of clinical science essential for the provision of patient care under supervision and includes emphasis on health promotion and disease prevention.
Step 3

Step 3 assesses whether you can apply medical knowledge and understanding of biomedical and clinical science essential for the unsupervised practice of medicine, with emphasis on patient management in ambulatory settings. It is the final examination in the USMLE sequence leading to a license to practice medicine without supervision.

How USMLE Work for Foreign Doctors

Foreign doctors who wish to practice medicine in the United States must also take and pass the USMLE, just like their U.S.-trained counterparts. The process for foreign doctors is slightly different and may involve additional requirements, such as certification from the Educational Commission for Foreign Medical Graduates (ECFMG).

Foreign doctors must first obtain ECFMG certification, which requires completion of medical school from an institution that is listed in the World Directory of Medical Schools and passing the USMLE Step 1 and Step 2 exams. They must also provide documentation of their medical education and training, as well as their English language proficiency.

After obtaining ECFMG certification, foreign doctors can then apply for residency programs in the United States. In some cases, they may also need to take the USMLE Step 3 exam to become eligible for medical licensure in certain states.

Overall, the USMLE is an essential component of the process for foreign doctors to practice medicine in the United States, along with obtaining ECFMG certification and completing a residency program.

US Medical Licence Requirements – USMLE Application Requirements

The USMLE application requirements vary depending on the specific exam and whether the applicant is a U.S. citizen or an international medical graduate. Here are some general requirements for each of the three steps:

USMLE Step 1:

  • Must be enrolled in or have graduated from a medical school accredited by the Liaison Committee on Medical Education (LCME) or the Commission on Osteopathic College Accreditation (COCA).
  • Must have a valid passport or government-issued identification.
  • Must pay the exam fee (currently $965 as of March 2024).

USMLE Step 2 CK (Clinical Knowledge) and Step 2 CS (Clinical Skills):

  • Must have passed USMLE Step 1.
  • Must be enrolled in or have graduated from a medical school accredited by the LCME or COCA.
  • Must have a valid passport or government-issued identification.
  • Must pay the exam fees (currently $965 for Step 2 CK and $1,580 for Step 2 CS as of March 2024).

USMLE Step 3:

  • Must have passed USMLE Step 1 and Step 2 CK.
  • Must have a medical degree from a medical school listed in the World Directory of Medical Schools.
  • Must have completed at least one year of postgraduate medical education in the United States or Canada.
  • Must have a valid passport or government-issued identification.
  • Must pay the exam fee (currently $1,390 as of March 2024).

USMLE Application 2024

To apply for the United State Medical Licensing Examination, follow this link.
Create USMLE Account with Email
To create a USMLE account, you can visit the official USMLE website (https://www.usmle.org/) and follow these steps:
    1. Click on the “Log In” button located at the top right corner of the page.
    2. Select “Create an Account” option.
    3. Fill out the required information, including your name, date of birth, email address, and preferred username and password.
    4. Review and agree to the terms and conditions.
    5. Complete the security verification process.
    6. Click on the “Create Account” button.

Once you have created your USMLE account, you can use it to apply for USMLE exams, access your exam scores, and manage your personal information. It’s important to keep your login credentials secure and to update your information as needed.

USMLE Login | Access and Managde USMLE Account

To log in to your USMLE account, you can
    1. Visit the official USMLE website (https://www.usmle.org/) and click on the “Log In” button located at the top right corner of the page.
    2. Enter your username and password that you used when creating your USMLE account.
    3. If you have forgotten your login credentials, you can use the “Forgot Your Username or Password?” option to reset your password or retrieve your username.

USMLE Password Reset

If you have forgotten your USMLE password, you can reset it by following these steps:
  1. Visit the official USMLE website (https://www.usmle.org/) and click on the “Log In” button at the top right corner.
  2. Click on the “Forgot Your Username or Password?” option.
  3. Enter the email address associated with your USMLE account and click on “Submit”.
  4. Follow the instructions in the password reset email that you receive from USMLE.
  5. Create a new password that meets the USMLE password requirements, which include a minimum of 8 characters, at least one uppercase letter, at least one lowercase letter, and at least one number.

If you continue to have issues with resetting your USMLE password, you can contact the USMLE program at the following email address: webmail@nbme.org

  • Medical Scholarships in UK, Europe, Australia

USMLE Fees 2024

The USMLE application fees vary depending on the exam and the jurisdiction in which you are taking the exam. Here are the current USMLE application fees for the most common exams:

  1. USMLE Step 1: $975
  2. USMLE Step 2 CK (Clinical Knowledge): $975
  3. USMLE Step 2 CS (Clinical Skills): $1,580
  4. USMLE Step 3: $1,365

Please note that these fees are subject to change, so it’s important to check the USMLE website (https://www.usmle.org/) for the most up-to-date information on application fees.

After USMLE Application, What Next

After submitting your USMLE application, the next step depends on the exam you are taking:

USMLE Step 1 and Step 2 CK:

Once your application is processed and your eligibility is confirmed, you will receive a scheduling permit that allows you to schedule your exam at a Prometric testing center. You can schedule your exam date and location online through the Prometric website.

USMLE Step 2 CS:

Once your application is processed and your eligibility is confirmed, you will receive a notice of scheduling that provides instructions on how to schedule your exam date and location at one of the five Clinical Skills Evaluation Centers (CSEC) in the United States.

USMLE Step 3:

Once your application is processed and your eligibility is confirmed, you will receive an email with instructions on how to schedule your exam date and location through the Prometric website.
